alert.note: Alert for Collier (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 11:17AM EDT until June 18 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Florida, including the following county, Collier. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1117 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to approaching thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Naples, Golden Gate Estates, Golden Gate, West Toll Gate On Alligator Alley, Vineyards, East Naples, Lely Resort, Naples Manor, North Naples, Naples Park, Lely, Pelican Bay, Quail Creek Estate, Intersection I-75 And Everglades Blvd and Picayune Strand State Forest. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
